glossdef.p: At Indiana University, Central Authentication Service (CAS) is a login service that allows you to access multiple password-protected web systems after logging in once on a central authentication server; this is often referred to as single sign-on.

CAS currently supports several IU web applications, including Oncourse, OneStart, SafeWord card authentication, TimeKeeping, PeopleSoft, HRMS (payroll), and the employee Paid Time Off (PTO) system. In the future, other IU systems will use CAS as well.
